title: Solutions Engineer
description:
**Vi söker en Solutions Engineer till Scaly!** 
 🚀
 



  





 Vill du kickstarta din resa inom tech, utvecklas snabbt och ta ett steg in i en värld där du får ansvar, förtroende och möjligheten att påverka från dag ett? Vill du jobba med proffs och lära dig av de vassaste i branschen? Då är Scaly platsen för dig!
 



 Vi växer och letar efter dig som vill jobba nära tekniken, kunderna och affären.
 



  





**Om oss på Scaly** 




 Vi är en strategisk techpartner åt nordiska företag som vill utveckla sina verksamheter med moderna, molnbaserade lösningar. Vårt fokus ligger på IT Service Management, Customer Experience och ERP. Vi hjälper våra kunder genom hela resan: från behovsanalys och val av plattform, via implementation, till långsiktig skalning. Vi sitter i fina lokaler på Strandvägen i Stockholm med en kultur som präglas av entreprenörskap och laganda.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Solutions Engineer får du en perfekt roll i skärningspunkten mellan support, implementation och kundkontakt. Du får tydlig onboarding och coachning av erfarna specialister för att lära dig hantverket bakom professionell IT-leverans. När du blivit varm i kläderna växer ansvaret snabbt med egna kunder och projekt.
 



  





**Du kommer bland annat att:** 




 🔹 Driva kunddialoger, tolka behov och formulera krav
 



 🔹 Konfigurera och anpassa kundernas system
 



 🔹 Delta i implementationer (testa, justera, dokumentera)
 



 🔹 Följa upp användarfrågor och äga ärenden hela vägen
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som har ett starkt intresse för IT och vill förstå hur system och verksamhet hänger ihop. Du är en problemlösare som trivs i dialog med användare och vill bygga en långsiktig karriär inom tech.
 



  





 🌟
 **Det är extra meriterande om du har tidigare kunskap eller erfarenhet av Helpdesk eller ITSM.** 




  





**Varför Scaly?** 




 ✅ Unik möjlighet att växa in i avancerade tech-roller
 



 ✅ Arbeta nära erfarna experter
 



 ✅ Snabbt eget ansvar och tydliga karriärvägar
 



 ✅ Resor kan förekomma (t.ex. utbildning i London/Amsterdam eller workshops i Spanien)
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Låter det här som din nästa utmaning? Skicka ett DM till mig eller maila din ansökan direkt till omid@scaly.se. Vi rekryterar löpande, så vänta inte med att höra av dig!

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
**Uppdraget:**
 En omfattande digital utveckling pågår inom hälso- och sjukvården, och nya IT-system och IT-tjänster för vård upphandlas och införs successivt. Ett gediget arbete med våra lösningar, både egenutvecklade, som upphandlade förvaltningar, krävs för att vi ska genomföra digitalisering med kvalitet och i enlighet med våra målbilder och strategier.
   

  

 Arbetet inkluderar bl.a
   

  

* Lösningsarkitekturarbete för egenutvecklade lösningar.
* Lösningsarkitekturarbete för upphandlade lösningar och förvaltningar. Arbete och samverkan med interna resurser och intressenter, men även med resurser hos leverantörer och inom region Stockholm.
* Att vara en del av lösningsanalyser utifrån olika delar i "Generationsskifte vårdens IT" (införandet av bl.a. ett nytt huvudjournalsystem).
* Förstärkning av befintliga resurser och strukturer i form av dialoger med diverse intressenter och översättningar av behov till möjliga lösningar.
* Vi behöver konsultstöd för att stärka upp befintliga resurser i det pågående arbetet. Konsulten kommer att ingå i avdelningen för IT strategi & styrning där Enterprise arkitektur ingår.


**SKA-Krav**
* Universitets- eller högskoleexamen i systemutveckling eller liknande.
* Minst 7 års erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt
* Genomfört två referensuppdrag av motsvarande omfattning och komplexitet
* Det ska ha varit åt en offentligfinansierad organisation
* Kunna skriva och tala flytande svenska.


**Omfattning:** 
 100%
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Avtalstid:** 
 Omgående - 6 månader (med option på förlängning 6+6 månader)
   

  

**Svarstid och svarssätt:**
 Vi ser fram -emot din intresseanmälan
 **senast 2026-02-10** 
 innehållande:
   

  

* CV på svenska i Word format
* Referens
* Översikt över kravuppfyllnad ska-krav med tydlig beskrivning av kunskaper, erfarenhet inom relevant område samt referensuppdrag
* Önskat timpris

title: Microsoft Licensing Specialist – var med när vi bygger vår nya License Desk!
description:
Vi på Fellowmind har jobbat med licenshantering länge, men det är ett område som vuxit mycket det senaste året! Nu bygger vi en dedikerad
 **License Desk** 
 som hjälper våra kunder att få
 **rätt licenser på rätt nivå** 
 – med kontroll, enkelhet och affärsnytta. Som Microsoft Licensing Specialist blir du experten i vår CSPleverans och den som gör komplexa licensfrågor begripliga i vardagen. 
 





 Fellowmind är en
 **ledande Microsoftpartner i Europa** 
 med ett tydligt fokus på helhet –
 **både verksamhet och teknik** 
 .  
 





 Som
 

**certifierad Cloud Solution Provider (CSP)** 


 hjälper vi kunderna att samla licenshantering, rådgivning och support
 **under ett tak** 
 , med
 **en kontaktväg** 
 ,
 **en faktura** 
 och
 **portalöversikt** 
 över licenser och kostnader.   
 




**Dina uppgifter – det du driver och levererar** 
  
 
* Säkerställa korrekt och ändamålsenlig licensiering inom Microsoft CSP 
 

  



 (Microsoft 365, Dynamics 365)


* Arbeta operativt med licenshantering i Fellowmind License Portal och Microsoft Partner Center – beställningar, ändringar, uppföljning och datakvalitet – som grund för korrekt fakturering och rådgivning.


* Genomföra licensöversyn och kostnadsoptimeringar samt ta fram tydliga licensrapporter som beslutsstöd för kund, sälj och Managed Services.


* Rådgiva kunder, säljare och projektledare kring licenstyper, dimensionering, NCE-villkor och policys, med tydlig koppling till affärsmål och efterlevnad.


* Följa och tolka förändringar i Microsofts regelverk, prissättning och licensvillkor (inkl. NCE) och översätta dem till konkreta rekommendationer och arbetssätt.


* Identifiera och hantera licensrelaterade risker – exempelvis compliance, felaktig licenssättning eller bristande dokumentation – innan de blir affärsproblem.


* Vara med och utveckla arbetssätt, processer och automatisering inom License Desk för att skapa kvalitet, skalbarhet och tydlighet över tid.


* Stötta sälj i offert- och avtalsprocesser genom korrekt licensmodellering och tydliga licensscenarier.


* Dokumentera hur licensupplägget är tänkt att fungera, inklusive de val som gjorts och eventuella begränsningar.



**Vi tror att du har** 
  
 
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft CSP och praktisk licenshantering i partner- eller större kundmiljö.


* God förståelse för licensmodeller inom Microsoft 365 samt Dynamics 365


* Vana av arbete i Microsoft 365 Admin Center, Entra ID och relaterade verktyg.


* Förmåga att tolka Microsofts produktvillkor, licensregler och kommersiella villkor (NCE).


* Förmåga att kommunicera licenslogik tydligt på svenska och engelska, både till tekniska och affärsnära mottagare.




**Som person tror vi att du:** 




* Trivs med ansvar, struktur och precision, men tappar inte helheten.


* Är självgående och initiativtagande, men samarbetar nära med kollegor inom sälj, Managed Services och leverans.


* Vill förstå varför licenser används – inte bara hur – och bidra till bättre beslut över tid.








*Till dig som går igenom nålsögat i vår rekryteringsprocess så erbjuder vi (förutom en fantastisk tillväxtresa) det som vi vill påstå är:* 
  
 




**Branschens bästa arbetsplats!** 
  
 


 Jag vet! Varje bolag med ett uns självaktning säger samma sak; medarbetarna är det viktigaste i verksamheten, vi är ett värderingsstyrt bolag och så vidare… men är det så FOR REAL? Jag vill i alla fall påstå det och här är lite om vad som erbjuds hos oss; 
 



* Ett företag där vi skippat så många skrivna regler som möjligt. Hos oss utgår vi från att alla är vuxna människor, med sunt förnuft och som fattar smarta beslut


* En roll där du är med och gör skillnad! På riktigt! Varje dag!


* Ett prestigelöst gäng som verkligen delar med sig av sin kunskap och är mån om att du ska blomstra hos oss


* Vi glömmer inte bort att skapa balans i livet, och vi hjälps åt precis som ett riktigt bra lag ska göra, vilket gör oss till antitesen till övertid, prestationsbaserade löner och vassa armbågar


* Väldigt hög flexibilitet när det gäller arbetstider och arbetsplats


* Ett bra förmånspaket bland annat med ett friskvårdsbidrag som är maximerat till vad Skatteverket tillåter för att inte bli förmånsbeskattad, möjlighet till hälsoundersökning, och en massa roliga aktiviteter, kolla gärna in vårt
 

**Instagram** 


 så förstår du vad vi menar!



**Det praktiska** 
  
 


 Start: Gärna så snabbt som möjligt, men vi har förståelse för att du har en uppsägningstid som behöver tas hänsyn till 
 





 Omfattning: Heltid, kontorstider, men vi är väldigt flexibla här och utgår från att det ska fungera för alla parter 
 





 Placering: På något av våra kontor i Malmö, Helsingborg, Göteborg, Jönköping eller Stockholm.

title: ProServe Area Leader (Nordics/BENELUX), Professional Services EMEA
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is looking for an experienced general manager, preferably from a professional services organization, to lead a direct team of sellers (ProServe Sales Managers, ProServe Account Executives, and or ProServe Cloud Architects), and partnering with Area delivery teams to achieve Area goals. As a direct report to the Nordics/BENELUX Geo Leader, the ProServe Area Leader (PAL) is responsible for ensuring the Nordics/BENELUX are equipped to support ProServe’s ability to engage new and existing customers through a variety of transformative projects involving IT Strategy, distributed architecture, and hybrid cloud operations. As the single threaded ProServe leader for the Nordics/BENELUX PALs are the “face of ProServe” and required to interlock with Amazon Global Sales (AGS) Leaders to ensure ProServe and AGS teams are working together as #OneAWSTeam to deliver bar raising customer business outcomes. PALs operate within the ProServe Geo leadership team, and are responsible for representing their Area, escalating blockers to performance, and ensuring teams are enabled to deliver results.
   

  

 PALs routinely engage with C-level executives within our customers to provide executive leadership, relationship management, and pre-sales support. Ultimately, they are responsible for ensuring Area teams (Sales, Delivery, Partner) work closely to drive business performance that meets and exceeds customer expectations. Acting as a path of escalation, internally and for customers, PALs are expected to be knowledgeable of our sales mechanisms, have knowledge of ProServe products and services, and be skilled at navigating executive relationships and enterprises to deliver outcomes for customers.
   

  

 Your experience gained within professional services will ideally be supported by broad technology sector knowledge, which will equip you with the ability to translate technical concepts into business value for customers. You will demonstrate proficiency in driving sales teams, and the ability to apply sales methodologies optimizing CRM systems coupled with strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management abilities. You will be measured on the Nordics/BENELUX performance against key metrics including but not limited to Revenue, Billable Bookings, operating margin, team engagement, and customer satisfaction.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 AWS Global Services includes experts from across AWS who help our customers design, build, operate, and secure their cloud environments. Customers innovate with AWS Professional Services, upskill with AWS Training and Certification, optimize with AWS Support and Managed Services, and meet objectives with AWS Security Assurance Services. Our expertise and emerging technologies include AWS Partners, AWS Sovereign Cloud, AWS International Product, and the Generative AI Innovation Center. You’ll join a diverse team of technical experts in dozens of countries who help customers achieve more with the AWS cloud.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced Professional Services Leader/General Manager, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Leading and developing a high-performing team of Account Executives and Cloud Architects
* Delivering against key metrics including but not limited to Revenue, Billable Bookings, operating margin, team engagement, and customer satisfaction
* Developing and supporting execution of sales strategies (including demand generation, strategic sales, GTM prioritisation) and Area operating strategies to meet team targets and drive revenue growth
* Managing customer relationships, ensuring high satisfaction and identifying new opportunities
* Leveraging deep AWS knowledge to guide sellers in proposing optimal solutions
* Monitoring and analyzing key performance indicators, ensuring accurate reporting and forecasting to optimize operational processes and manage risk


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 10+ years in technology sales, with 5+ years in management [Alternative: Experience in professional services business management, technology sales and people leadership.]
* Experience with cloud technologies
* Experience in leading business development activities and managing sales cycles through a direct Management team
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
* Ability to build and maintain C-level client relationships
* Experience in AWS, Azure or Google Cloud technology


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54
   

  

 Job ID: A3015639

title: Data & AI Platform - Center of Enablement Manager
description:
Are you excited by the idea of running a modern data platform that our engineers rely on every day? Join us in shaping our architecture, coaching teams, and turning best practice into golden paths that make great engineering the easy choice!
   

  

**Why Sandvik Coromant?**
 We’re a global leader where data, AI, and automation directly power real manufacturing impact – and where your platform becomes the backbone for product teams across the business. We don’t just lead the manufacturing industry – we’re reshaping it. As a global frontrunner in advanced manufacturing, we're on a journey to transform how we work and how we create value.
   

  

 The industry’s evolving fast, and we’re responding with smart, end-to-end solutions powered by bold ideas and passionate people. This is your chance to join a high-trust, empowered team that challenges the status quo and puts customers at the center of everything we do. Let’s shape the future of manufacturing together!
   

  

**Your mission**
 In this position, you lead the strategy, architecture, and operations of our Data and AI Experience Platform as well as our team of Platform Engineers and Architects. You ensure platform reliability, cost compliance, and vendor alignment while driving technical excellence and fostering a strong engineering culture. Acting as our go-to expert for critical challenges, you coach engineers, shape best practices, and enable autonomous product teams through optimized architecture and self-service capabilities. You define standards and services which make it easy for your team to do the right thing while experimenting and building autonomy, compliance, security, cost efficiency and reliability.
   

  

 You lead through example – continuously learning and experimenting with new technologies, building solutions hands-on, and coaching others. Create space and opportunities for team learning, foster collaboration, and confidently make informed technical decisions that inspire trust and growth. Adoption is your success currency, and you constantly find ways in which your team can improve Monthly Active Engineers and Monthly Active Champions on your platform.
   

  

**Location and flexibility**
 The location for this position is either Sandviken or Stockholm, with a hybrid setup where you can combine office and remote work.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We’re looking for someone with several years of experience in engineering and technology roles combined with some experience from leadership and people management. The ideal candidate has a background with at least one of the following roles: Data & Analytics Architect, Platform Architect or AI Architect. Acting in a global environment calls for excellent skills in English, verbally and in writing.
   

  

 You have proven expertise with:
   

  

* Cloud computing service providers, preferably Microsoft Azure.
* Lakehouse service providers, preferably Databricks.
* Embedded Data Warehouse and Analytics providers, preferably SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud.
* Expert software engineering skills in Python, SQL, C# or similar languages.


 Success in this role comes from strategic thinking with hands‑on technical curiosity, bringing a natural drive to explore new ideas and solve complex challenges. You lead with openness and empathy, coaching others and building trust across teams while remaining calm and confident in your decisions. With a collaborative mindset and a genuine focus on customer needs, you create clarity, foster autonomy, and inspire a strong engineering culture grounded in learning, inclusivity, and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Our culture**
 Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.

 Are you curious to know more about this position? Please contact Anton Peters, Head of Data & AI, at anton.peters@sandvik.com

title: Head of AI
description:
**What We Do At Qliro**
 At Qliro, we develop a world-leading payment experience for merchants and their customers. We make payments simple, secure, and built for growth. As a trusted partner, we help merchants succeed every day — because when they grow, we grow. Our team brings together expertise, curiosity, and collaboration to keep redefining what payments can be across the Nordics.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a
 **Head of AI** 
 to lead one of the most important transformations in Qliro’s history. This is a rare opportunity to shape how AI becomes a strategic engine for efficiency, innovation, and next-generation payments, not as a side initiative, but as a core driver of value across the entire business.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Set and lead Qliro’s AI strategy, adoption frameworks, and ethical/regulatory principles
* Identify, scope, and prioritize high-value AI use cases together with business stakeholders, ensuring clear ROI and shared P&L ownership
* Manage the AI roadmap, budget, and external vendor partnerships
* Drive company-wide adoption through training, hands-on enablement, and change leadership
* Build a long-term perspective on how AI will evolve Qliro’s technology architecture and reshape the future purchase experience
* Act as a cross-functional driver, working closely with teams across technology, operations, product, commercial, and more
* Report to the Chief Strategy Officer, taking a senior individual-contributor role with the potential to grow into building and leading a dedicated function over time


**We believe you**
* Bring the strategic height to define a bold AI vision, and the pragmatism to turn it into a clear, actionable roadmap
* Have strong project and change management skills, with a track record of driving execution across multiple stakeholders
* Understand how data flows, AI tools, and operational realities come together to deliver measurable impact
* Are an energetic, collaborative leader who inspires adoption and brings people along on the journey
* Thrive in fast-moving environments where you combine hands-on experimentation with long-term thinking
* If you have previous experience from driving initiatives within AI from top tier management consultancy companies, this is highly beneficial


**What’s In It For You**
**Strategic impact:** 
 Lead one of Qliro’s most important transformations, defining our AI strategy and ensuring adoption is responsible, structured, and value-driven
   

  

**End-to-end ownership:** 
 From identifying use cases to managing the AI budget and vendor ecosystem, you’ll own both the roadmap and the delivery of tangible business results
   

  

**Change leadership:** 
 Drive real adoption across teams — not through theory, but by making AI practical, accessible, and indispensable in day-to-day operations
   

  

**High visibility:** 
 Work closely with Qliro’s executive team and all core functions, playing a central role in shaping our future
   

  

**Future building:** 
 Look beyond immediate efficiency gains to define how AI will influence our tech architecture and the next generation of the e-commerce purchase experience
   

  

 This role is perfect for someone who wants to sit at the center of transformation: visionary enough to see what’s next, pragmatic enough to deliver impact today, and hands-on enough to make adoption real.
   

  

**Does this sound like your next role?** 
 Apply now and become part of our journey at Qliro!
   

  

 Qliro is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation or age.

title: Data & AI Platform - Center of Enablement Manager
description:
Are you excited by the idea of running a modern data platform that our engineers rely on every day? Join us in shaping our architecture, coaching teams, and turning best practice into golden paths that make great engineering the easy choice!
   

  

**Why Sandvik Coromant?**
 We’re a global leader where data, AI, and automation directly power real manufacturing impact – and where your platform becomes the backbone for product teams across the business. We don’t just lead the manufacturing industry – we’re reshaping it. As a global frontrunner in advanced manufacturing, we're on a journey to transform how we work and how we create value.
   

  

 The industry’s evolving fast, and we’re responding with smart, end-to-end solutions powered by bold ideas and passionate people. This is your chance to join a high-trust, empowered team that challenges the status quo and puts customers at the center of everything we do. Let’s shape the future of manufacturing together!
   

  

**Your mission**
 In this position, you lead the strategy, architecture, and operations of our Data and AI Experience Platform as well as our team of Platform Engineers and Architects. You ensure platform reliability, cost compliance, and vendor alignment while driving technical excellence and fostering a strong engineering culture. Acting as our go-to expert for critical challenges, you coach engineers, shape best practices, and enable autonomous product teams through optimized architecture and self-service capabilities. You define standards and services which make it easy for your team to do the right thing while experimenting and building autonomy, compliance, security, cost efficiency and reliability.
   

  

 You lead through example – continuously learning and experimenting with new technologies, building solutions hands-on, and coaching others. Create space and opportunities for team learning, foster collaboration, and confidently make informed technical decisions that inspire trust and growth. Adoption is your success currency, and you constantly find ways in which your team can improve Monthly Active Engineers and Monthly Active Champions on your platform.
   

  

**Location and flexibility**
 The location for this position is either Sandviken or Stockholm, with a hybrid setup where you can combine office and remote work.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We’re looking for someone with several years of experience in engineering and technology roles combined with some experience from leadership and people management. The ideal candidate has a background with at least one of the following roles: Data & Analytics Architect, Platform Architect or AI Architect. Acting in a global environment calls for excellent skills in English, verbally and in writing.
   

  

 You have proven expertise with:
   

  

* Cloud computing service providers, preferably Microsoft Azure.
* Lakehouse service providers, preferably Databricks.
* Embedded Data Warehouse and Analytics providers, preferably SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud.
* Expert software engineering skills in Python, SQL, C# or similar languages.


 Success in this role comes from strategic thinking with hands‑on technical curiosity, bringing a natural drive to explore new ideas and solve complex challenges. You lead with openness and empathy, coaching others and building trust across teams while remaining calm and confident in your decisions. With a collaborative mindset and a genuine focus on customer needs, you create clarity, foster autonomy, and inspire a strong engineering culture grounded in learning, inclusivity, and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Our culture**
 Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 Are you curious to know more about this position? Please contact Anton Peters, Head of Data & AI, at anton.peters@sandvik.com

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Senior Data Engineer** 




  





 We're currently recruiting for Senior Data Engineers for one of Sweden’s leading consultancies, known for long-term client partnerships and strong delivery within digital transformation.
 



  





 You’ll join a data team of around 50 specialists in Sweden, working on large-scale, modern data initiatives. Many of the Stockholm assignments are team-based deliveries, giving you the opportunity to collaborate closely with other experienced data professionals rather than working in isolation.
 



  





**The role:** 




  





 As a Senior Data Engineer, you’ll work with both public and private sector clients on projects that focus on modernising entire data platforms. This typically involves transforming legacy on-prem environments into scalable, cloud-based solutions using Azure Synapse, Microsoft Fabric, or Azure Databricks.
 



  





**Your work will span:** 



* Modern data platforms and cloud architectures
* Data modelling and pipelines
* Analytics, visualisation, and insights
* Creating real business value from data end to end



  





**What they're looking for:** 



* 4+ years of experience as a Data Engineer
* Hands-on experience with Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse, or Azure Databricks
* Strong understanding of modern data platforms and cloud-based solutions
* **MUST HAVE** 
 - Swedish speaking fluency



  





**Why join?** 



* Be part of one of the strongest data communities in Sweden
* Team-based project delivery and long-term client engagements
* Strong focus on continuous development
* Internal seminars, structured training programs, and certification bonuses
* Access to national tech and data conferences
* Competitive benefits and a healthy work–life balance



  





 If you’re interested in working on modern cloud data platforms, large-scale transformations, and collaborative team deliveries, this could be a great next step.

title: Production Engineer - Pharma
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your Role**
 We are looking for a Production Engineer for our pharmaceutical projects in Stockholm
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Operating independently within your area of expertise and lead others while driving competence development.
* Investigating deviations, support production technical issues, and contribute to improvement projects.
* Manage tasks such as issuing recipes and batch records, coordinating installations, or producing plant layouts and detailed designs.
* Lead or participate in subprojects related to process engineering, automation, or plant design.
* Ensure quality and documentation compliance according to given guidelines.


**Your Profile**
* Master’s or bachelor’s degree in science (or equivalent).
* Process development and technology with experience from Process technology, Automation, Facility project planning (Mechanical and Production technology)
* Strong technical proficiency in Process Engineering, Automation, Plant Design, or Project Management.
* Ability to work autonomously and deliver results based on guidelines while assuring quality.
* Experience in leading small projects or subprojects and collaborating across functions such as plant engineers and design engineers.
* Good communication and problem-solving skills to support production and improvement initiatives.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

 Valid work permit for Sweden is required.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Specialister inom Datacenter nät och Nätsäkerhet
description:
emagine söker efter två specialister inom Datacenter nät och Nätsäkerhet för en väldigt spännande kund.
   

  

**Start: ASAP (efter säkerhetsklassning) kan bli i mars , Men processen startar nu**
**Längd: 6 månader till att börja med**
**Plats: Stockholm, man måste vara villig/kunna vara på plats upp till 5 dagar i veckan**
 Syfte med rollen
   

  

 Ansvarar för att utveckla, förvalta och säkra organisationens datacenter nätverk och nätverksinfrastruktur.
   

  

 Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden
   

  

* Designa, implementera och vidareutveckla datacenter nätverk.
* Säkerställa stabil drift, kapacitet och redundans.
* Ansvara för nätverkssäkerhet (brandväggar, IDS/IPS, VPN, Zero Trust).
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av NIS2, ISO27001 och relevanta regelverk.
* Implementera nätövervakning, loggning och incidentberedskap.
* Samverka med IT-drift, säkerhetsteam och leverantörer.


 Kravprofil
   

  

* Flerårig erfarenhet av datacenter nätverk i komplexa miljöer.
* Djup kunskap inom routing/switching (BGP, OSPF, VLAN, EVPN).
* Erfarenhet av nätverkssäkerhet och segmentering.
* Meriterande med cloud networking och automatisering.


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

* Analytisk och strukturerad.
* Hög säkerhetsmedvetenhet.
* Stark samarbetsförmåga och tydlig kommunikation.


 Strategisk betydelse
   

  

 Rollen är central för att säkerställa en robust, framtidssäkrad och cybersäkra digital infrastruktur.
   

  

**Övrigt**
* Säkerhetsklassad tjänst: Drog- och alkoholtest, bakgrundskontroll samt säkerhetsprövning krävs. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav och ska kunna flytande svenska, tal och skrift

title: VIE Software Engineers | Sweden
description:
Are you passionate about cloud technologies or full-stack development, and eager to kick-start your international career?
 



  





 At ALTEN, we are currently looking for DevOps and Fullstack developers for our current projects. We collaborate with some of Sweden's most prominent technology companies – including leading players in energy, industry, and digitalization – and we are looking for someone who thrives at the intersection of technology, business, and leadership.
 



  





  





**WHAT DO WE OFFER
 
 ?** 




 As a consultant at ALTEN, you'll have the opportunity to work on challenging and exciting projects with some of our key clients, with:
 


* Technical challenges and development opportunities.
* An inspiring community and the chance to contribute to a sustainable future.
* Supportive and coaching leadership.
* The possibility to work across various industries where our clients operate.
* A personal training budget for internal or external courses.



  





  





**ABOUT THE ROLE**




 We are looking for FullStack Developers (.NET + React and/or Angular with AWS) to join us through a VIE (Volontariat International en Entreprise) program. This is your chance to work on impactful, real world projects within a modern tech environment and collaborate closely with talented teams across Europe!
 



  





 This VIE assignment is based in Sweden, so applicants must:
 


* Be between the ages of 18 and 28.
* **Not** 
 previously worked or been tax resident in Sweden.
* Be open to relocate to Sweden
* Hold a bachelor degree in engineering or computer science.
* Hold a citizenship of an EEA country (European Economic Area).



  





**Full-Stack** 
 profiles:
 



 As a FullStack Developer, you'll work with a .NET backend and React and/or Angular on the frontend, building high-quality, user focused applications deployed on AWS. You’ll be involved in the entire development lifecycle from architecture and coding to testing and cloud deployment while contributing to innovative features in an agile, fast-paced environment.
 



  





  





**ABOUT ALTEN**




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies, with over 57,000 employees across approximately 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the entire product development chain for leading companies in several industries including Automotive, Defense & Security, Energy, Industrial Equipment, Public Sector, and Life Sciences.
 



 In Sweden, we are approximately 1,300 dedicated employees spread across 9 offices in cities ranging from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.
 



 For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden’s most attractive employers by
 *Karriärföretagen* 
 for five consecutive years — an award for companies offering unique career and development opportunities.
 



  





  





 If you're excited about living abroad, developing cutting-edge skills, and building a strong international profile within an innovative company, we’d love to meet you.
 



  





 Welcome to read more about us at alten.se

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we keep it simple: you bring your best to us, and we'll bring out the best in you. We're builders touching over 20 industries and 80% of global commerce, and we need your unique talents to help shape what's next. The work is challenging – but it matters. You'll find a place where you can be yourself, prioritize your wellbeing, and truly belong. What's in it for you? Constant learning, skill growth, great benefits, and a team that wants you to grow and succeed.
   

  

**What You’ll Build**
 As part of SAP’s Enterprise Architecture team, you will lead customers through their digital transformation journeys — from strategy to execution. You’ll help shape their NorthStar Enterprise Architecture, guide clean core adoption, and translate architectural visions into tangible outcomes through SAP solutions, including the Business Technology Platform (BTP).
   

  

**You Will**
* Advise customers on future-proofing their IT landscapes, helping them simplify, modernize, and accelerate innovation.
* Collaboratively develop a capability/application as-is and target the enterprise architecture model based on SAP’s reference industry architecture
* Drive the Clean Core imperative by reducing complexity, consolidating systems, and streamlining processes.
* Enable organizations to realize the full value of SAP BTP through integration, extensibility, and process optimization.
* Advise and drive AI capability Adoption across the customer organization
* Act as a trusted advisor across business and IT functions, helping customers align technology decisions with strategic business goals.
* Work collaboratively with senior stakeholders to drive adoption and consumption in order to deliver exceptional Cloud Subscription Renewals


**What You Bring**
 You are a seasoned professional who combines deep Enterprise Architecture expertise with business acumen and a genuine empathy for customers.
   

  

**Must-have**
* 10+ years of experience in customer-facing roles (e.g., Enterprise Architect, Consultant, Program Manager, Solution Architect, Customer Advisory,…)
* Track record in helping customers/stakeholders drive business adoption of technology solutions in order to unlock tangible business value and maximise consumption
* Proven track record in delivering enterprise business transformations through large-scale application delivery and implementation programs
* Demonstrated SAP S/4HANA application/functional knowledge and advising and applying Clean Core framework
* Exceptional communication, influencing, and negotiation skills in English, with the ability to engage senior stakeholders across IT and business.
* Ability to operate in large and complex organizations with multiple stakeholders


**Nice To Have**
* Experience using SAP LeanIX and Signavio to document architectures and business processes.
* Familiarity with SAP Cloud solutions / Business Capabilities and SAP Business AI
* Familiarity with BTP Integration Suite / BTP Build
* Professional Certifications such as SAP Enterprise Architecture Framework (LeanIX EAM), SAP Certified Professional–Enterprise Architect (P\_SAPEA\_2023), or TOGAF.


**Where you belong**
 Join a diverse and passionate team of
 **SAP Enterprise Architects** 
 driving meaningful digital transformation across industries.
   

  

 We collaborate closely with various SAP teams and SAP partners, turning strategy into execution with a focus on innovation and business impact.
   

  

**Locations:**
 Stockholm, Gothenburg, Helsinki, Oslo or Copenhagen (Kindly only apply for one location)
   

  

**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better world.
   

  

 SAP is committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provides accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability, in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local legal requirements.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

**AI Usage in the Recruitment Process**
 For information on the responsible use of AI in our recruitment process, please refer to our Guidelines for Ethical Usage of AI in the Recruiting Process.
   

  

 Please note that any violation of these guidelines may result in disqualification from the hiring process.
